Key Match Events: Burundi scored three goals, including a late winner by Eldino; Malawi scored twice in response; the match was Burundi's first in the 2025 Afcon qualifiers; Burundi led at halftime 2-1; Malawi's Chawanangwa Kaonga scored an equalizer; Eldino scored the winner in the 87th minute; Malawi's Lanjesi Nkhoma scored a goal in the 75th minute;
Pre-Game Insights: The match was the second meeting between the two teams across all competitions; Malawi was the host; Burundi's coach Patrick Mabedi noted the team's bright start; Malawi had a throw-in incident that led to a corner-kick;
Post-Match Reflections: Burundi secured a crucial win; Malawi remained bottom of the group; both teams have upcoming matches in the qualifiers;
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was live on TV; Burundi's starting XI included Mateo Nkurunzinza, Aruna Madjaliwa, and Youssuf Ndayishimiye; Malawi's starting XI included George Chikooka, Stanley Sanudi, and Lanjesi Nkhoma;
